articles.author: FRANKLIN BRICEÑO
articles.description: LIMA, Peru (AP) — Alberto Fujimori, whose decade-long presidency began with triumphs righting Peru’s economy and defeating a brutal insurgency only to end in a disgrace of autocratic excess that later sent him to prison, has died.
articles.title: Alberto Fujimori, a former president of Peru who was convicted for human rights abuses, dies at 86

articles.author: JACK BROOK and SARA CLINE
articles.description: MORGAN CITY, La. (AP) — Hurricane Francine struck the Louisiana coast Wednesday evening as a dangerous Category 2 storm that rapidly knocked out electricity to more than 100,000 customers and threatened widespread flooding as it sent potentially deadly storm surge rushing inland along the northern U.S.
articles.title: Hurricane Francine makes landfall in Louisiana as a Category 2 storm

articles.author: PATRICK AFTOORA ORSAGOS, JULIE CARR SMYTH AND ELLIOT SPAGAT
articles.description: SPRINGFIELD, Ohio (AP) — Many cities have been reshaped by immigrants in the last few years without attracting much notice. Not Springfield, Ohio.Its story of economic renewal and related growing pains has been thrust into the national conversation in a presidential election year — and maliciously distorted by false rumors that Haitian immigrants are eating their neighbors’ pets.
articles.title: An Ohio city reshaped by Haitian immigrants lands in an unwelcome spotlight

articles.author: JENNIFER PELTZ and KAREN MATTHEWS
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — With presidential candidates looking on, some 9/11 victims’ relatives appealed to them Wednesday for accountability as the U.S.
articles.title: 9/11 anniversary brings Biden, Harris and Trump together at ground zero

articles.author: BILL BARROW, MARY CLARE JALONICK, MICHELLE L. PRICE, ZEKE MILLER and ADRIANA GOMEZ LICON
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Donald Trump emerged Wednesday from a rocky debate against Kamala Harris looking to regain his footing with 55 days until Election Day, the first ballots already going out in Alabama and other states on the cusp of early voting.
articles.title: Donald Trump faces his own debate fallout just months after benefiting from Joe Biden's

articles.author: FRANKLIN BRICEÑO
articles.description: LIMA, Peru (AP) — Alberto Fujimori, whose decade-long presidency began with triumphs righting Peru’s economy and defeating a brutal insurgency only to end in a disgrace of autocratic excess that later sent him to prison, has died.
articles.title: Alberto Fujimori, a former president of Peru who was convicted for human rights abuses, dies at 86

articles.author: EUGENE GARCIA, ERIC THAYER, AMY TAXIN and OLGA R. RODRIGUEZ
articles.description: WRIGHTWOOD, Calif. (AP) — Three major wildfires in Southern California's mountains east of Los Angeles torched dozens of homes and forced thousands of people to flee their towns, officials said Wednesday.
articles.title: Wildfires in Southern California torch dozens of homes and force thousands to evacuate

articles.author: KEVIN FREKING
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Speaker Mike Johnson postponed a vote Wednesday on a temporary spending bill that would keep federal agencies and programs funded for six months as opposition from both parties thwarted his first attempt at avoiding a partial government shutdown in three weeks.
articles.title: Speaker Johnson postpones vote on a bill to avoid a partial government shutdown

articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israeli airstrikes across Gaza overnight and Wednesday hit a U.N.
articles.title: Israeli airstrikes hit UN school and homes in Gaza and kill at least 34 people, hospitals say

articles.author: JIM MUSTIAN and JOSHUA GOODMAN
articles.description: LEESBURG, Va. (AP) — At an impromptu party in the office to celebrate his 50th birthday, a veteran CIA officer got drunk, reached up a colleague’s skirt and forcibly kissed her in front of stunned co-workers, prosecutors alleged in the latest case of sexual misconduct to spill from the spy agency into a public court.
articles.title: New CIA workplace assault case emerges as spy agency shields extent of sexual misconduct in ranks
